title: Jamie Bhatti
text:
Jamie Bhatti (born 8 September 1993 in <a href="Stirling">Stirling</a>) is a <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="Rugby%20Union">rugby union</a> player who currently plays as a <a href="Prop%20%28rugby%20union%29">loose head prop</a> for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>. He previously played for <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a> and <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath Rugby</a>; and had at prior stint at <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>.
Background.
Bhatti was born in <a href="Stirling">Stirling</a> on 8 September 1993. His surname is of Indian origin; his paternal grandfather <a href="Modern%20immigration%20to%20the%20United%20Kingdom%23British%20Empire%20and%20the%20Commonwealth">emigrated to Scotland</a> from <a href="Ludhiana">Ludhiana</a> in the 1960s. As a teenager he worked in an <a href="abattoir">abattoir</a> and as a nightclub <a href="Bouncer%20%28doorman%29">door steward</a> and applied unsuccessfully to become a <a href="police%20officer">police officer</a> before turning professional in rugby.
Rugby union career.
Amateur career.
Bhatti started his youth rugby with Hillfoot Minis before moving on to <a href="Stirling%20County%20RFC">Stirling County</a> where he came through the age grades of midi and colts before playing for the senior side. He then moved to play for <a href="Melrose%20RFC">Melrose</a>. He has played for the Caledonia district at Under 17, Under 18 and Under 19 age grades. When not playing for Glasgow Warriors, Bhatti plays for Melrose RFC.
Bhatti has been drafted to <a href="Ayr%20RFC">Ayr</a> in the <a href="Scottish%20Premiership%20%28rugby%29">Scottish Premiership</a> for the 2018-19 season.
Professional career.
Bhatti was awarded a place in the <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy">Scottish Rugby Academy</a> for season <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy%202016-17">2016-17</a>. He was a Stage 3 player for Glasgow and the West regional academy.
Bhatti made his debut for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> on 30 August 2016. He played at <a href="Bridgehaugh%20Park">Bridgehaugh Park</a> for the Warriors against <a href="Canada%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada 'A'</a>.
Bhatti was selected for Scotland's 2018-19 Summer Tour to Canada, America and Argentina.
In December 2020, Bhatti signed for <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">Premiership Rugby</a> side <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a> as injury cover until the end of the season.
On 22 January 2021, Bhatti will return to <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> in the <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a> for a second stint from the 2021-22 season. 
International career.
He has represented Scotland at <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-17%20rugby%20union%20team">Under 17</a>, <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">Under 18</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-19%20rugby%20union%20team">Under 19 age</a> grades. He was later capped for <a href="Scotland%20Club%20XV">Scotland Club XV</a>. Bhatti received his first call up to the senior <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> squad by coach <a href="Gregor%20Townsend">Gregor Townsend</a> in October 2017 for the <a href="2017%20end-of-year%20rugby%20union%20internationals">Autumn Internationals</a>, appearing as a replacement in all three tests including a historic win over <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>.
